page.title: 14OUR VISIT TO THE FARM
page.content: It was a good job we has our wellingtons on, because the path to the farmyard was muddy where the tractor had left its clay trail. Oh what a smell - as we got closer you could tell there were cows around, or else they had been around. It was overpowering at first but, like the farmer we got used to it. The farmer showed us round. The milking parlour was spotless and full of glass octopuses. The tubes from jars dangling down waiting to catch a cow. In the yard there were sheds with some small calves in and others with two huge bulbs. The farmer shouted at some lads to get away from the bulbs, but they had already decided to do that. The farmhouse was like a mansion with a moat around it. In the moat ducks swam quietly.
